Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2013 07:27PM LisaMM wrote: Lmimp64-I just had my first chmeo infusion 2 days ago.  Later that evening I got tingling in my fingers and toes.  Much later on, I needed to take an ativan to help me fall asleep.  I don't know if the tingling decreased on it's own or if the Ativan helped.  As for the Claritin, it is being used to help alleviate the side effect of bone pain from the Neulasta injections usually given the day after chemo to help keep white blood cell counts healthy.  I am using the Claritin now as I had the injection yesterday.  The dose is a 24 hr. tablet the day before the injection, again an hour before, then for 5 days after.  I found alot of good and comforting info in these discussions, try to keep up with them.  There's another one I follow regularly also that you may benefit from-Starting Chemo February 2013.  There's alot of good support here also! I think we're all a ball of nerves on fire when we're starting out, that's how I felt!
